body:
@vostrnad 

What is the Boost version you are using to compile your binaries?

Does error happen on your system with [release](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-24.0/test.rc2/bitcoin-24.0rc2-win64.zip) binaries?

Is your Windows localized?

@hebasto Thank you for your response. I install dependencies with vcpkg as per the MSVC build instructions, so I assume my Boost version will be correct, but I don't know how to check what version I'm using.

The release unit test binary has no failing tests, but it says `Running 527 test cases...` instead of 528. When I compare the outputs of running `test_bitcoin.exe -l test_suite`, the `run_command` test case is not present in the release binary output:
```
test/system_tests.cpp(24): Entering test suite "system_tests"
test/system_tests.cpp(28): Entering test case "dummy"
test/system_tests.cpp(28): Leaving test case "dummy"; testing time: 12072us
test/system_tests.cpp(24): Leaving test suite "system_tests"; testing time: 15387us
```
vs
```
C:\bitcoin\src\test\system_tests.cpp(24): Entering test suite "system_tests"
C:\bitcoin\src\test\system_tests.cpp(28): Entering test case "dummy"
C:\bitcoin\src\test\system_tests.cpp(28): Leaving test case "dummy"; testing time: 9513us
C:\bitcoin\src\test\system_tests.cpp(35): Entering test case "run_command"
C:/bitcoin/src/test/system_tests.cpp(64): error: in "system_tests/run_command": check what.find(expected) != std::string::npos has failed
C:\bitcoin\src\test\system_tests.cpp(35): Leaving test case "run_command"; testing time: 58694us
C:\bitcoin\src\test\system_tests.cpp(24): Leaving test suite "system_tests"; testing time: 80393us
```

My Windows is for the most part not localized. I have English (US) and Czech set as preferred languages (in this order, so almost everything is in English) and use the Czech regional format.
